name: Buda Castle
description: A historic castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings, offering stunning views of the Danube River and the city. It's a UNESCO World Heritage site and a symbol of Hungarian history.

name: Fisherman's Bastion
description: A panoramic terrace in neo-Romanesque style that provides one of the best views of Budapest, especially the Parliament building. Its turrets and ramparts resemble a fairy tale castle.

name: Széchenyi Thermal Bath
description: One of the largest and most famous thermal baths in Europe, known for its grand architecture and outdoor thermal pools. A perfect place to relax and unwind.

name: Hungarian Parliament Building
description: An architectural masterpiece and the largest building in Hungary, known for its stunning Gothic Revival style and rich history. Visitors can explore its impressive interior.

name: Heroes' Square
description: A significant historical site featuring the Millenary Monument, which honors the leaders of the seven tribes that founded Hungary. It’s surrounded by the Museum of Fine Arts and the Palace of Art.

name: Lake Balaton
description: Known as the 'Hungarian Sea,' it's the largest lake in Central Europe, offering stunning views, water sports, and vineyards. A popular summer destination for relaxation and recreation.

name: Eger Castle
description: A historic castle known for its role in the defense against the Ottoman Empire and its stunning views of the city. Visitors can explore the castle's museum and enjoy the surrounding gardens.

name: The Great Market Hall
description: The largest and oldest indoor market in Budapest, featuring a vibrant atmosphere with local produce, traditional Hungarian foods, and unique souvenirs. A must-visit for food lovers.

name: Danube Bend
description: A picturesque bend in the Danube River, surrounded by hills and charming towns. It's an ideal spot for hiking, cycling, and exploring historic sites like the Esztergom Basilica.

name: Szentendre
description: A charming riverside town known for its art galleries, museums, and colorful Baroque architecture. Szentendre is a cultural hub and a great place for leisurely strolls.

name: Visegrád Citadel
description: A medieval fortress overlooking the Danube River, offering panoramic views and a glimpse into Hungary's royal history. The site is also perfect for hiking and enjoying nature.

name: Gödöllő Palace
description: A beautiful baroque palace that was a favorite residence of Queen Elisabeth of Hungary. Visitors can explore its stunning gardens and opulent interiors.

name: Pécs
description: A city rich in history and culture, known for its Mediterranean atmosphere, ancient Roman ruins, and vibrant arts scene. The UNESCO-listed Early Christian Necropolis is a highlight.

name: Keszthely Castle
description: A stunning baroque palace located on the shores of Lake Balaton, known for its beautiful gardens and museum. It reflects the history of the local aristocracy.

name: Tihany Abbey
description: An ancient Benedictine monastery situated on a peninsula overlooking Lake Balaton, famous for its stunning views and historical significance. The lavender fields in the area are a seasonal attraction.

name: Miskolctapolca Cave Bath
description: A unique thermal bath complex featuring natural cave formations and thermal waters. It's an unusual and relaxing experience for visitors.

name: Aggtelek National Park
description: Home to the famous Baradla Cave, this national park is known for its stunning limestone formations and rich biodiversity. Ideal for hiking and exploring the natural beauty of Hungary.

name: Hortobágy National Park
description: The largest continuous grassland in Europe, known for its unique wildlife, traditional shepherd culture, and vast landscapes. It's a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Sárospatak Castle
description: A historic castle with a blend of Gothic and Renaissance architecture, known for its beautiful location by the Bodrog River. It has a rich history and offers guided tours.

name: Budapest Ruin Bars
description: Unique bars located in abandoned buildings and courtyards, known for their eclectic decor and vibrant nightlife. These ruin bars are a cultural phenomenon and a must-visit.

name: Lillafüred
description: A picturesque resort area featuring beautiful lakes, waterfalls, and hiking trails. The Palace Hotel here offers stunning views and access to nature.

name: Tokaj Wine Region
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its sweet wines, particularly Tokaji Aszú. Visitors can explore vineyards, attend wine tastings, and learn about the winemaking process.

name: Kecskemét
description: Famous for its Art Nouveau architecture and rich cultural heritage. The city is also known for its fruit brandies and vibrant festivals.

name: Nagykanizsa
description: A lesser-known city with a rich history, featuring beautiful architecture and museums. It's a great place to explore local culture and traditions.

name: Civita di Bagnoregio
description: Often called the 'dying town,' this stunning hilltop village is known for its picturesque views and unique geological features. It's a hidden gem worth visiting.

name: Zalakaros Thermal Bath
description: A family-friendly thermal spa known for its wellness facilities and outdoor pools. It's a great spot for relaxation and fun.

name: Sopron
description: A historic town near the Austrian border, known for its medieval architecture and vibrant cultural scene. The Firewatch Tower offers panoramic views of the city.

name: Veszprém
description: One of Hungary's oldest cities, known for its charming streets, historic buildings, and the Veszprém Castle. It's a cultural center with a rich history.

name: Káposztásmegyer
description: A hidden gem in Budapest with beautiful parks and nature reserves, perfect for outdoor activities and relaxation away from the city's hustle.

name: Mátra Mountains
description: A mountain range offering hiking trails, stunning landscapes, and the highest peak in Hungary, Kékes. Ideal for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts.

name: Fertő-Hanság National Park
description: A UNESCO Biosphere Reserve known for its rich wildlife and diverse ecosystems. Visitors can enjoy birdwatching, hiking, and exploring the beautiful landscapes.

name: Békéscsaba
description: Known as the home of the famous Hungarian sausage, this town offers a rich culinary experience. It's a great place to explore local traditions and festivals.

name: Kiskunság National Park
description: A protected area known for its unique wetlands and diverse wildlife, including a variety of bird species. It's perfect for nature walks and photography.

name: Szeged
description: Famous for its open-air festivals, including the Szeged Open-Air Festival. The city is also known for its beautiful Art Nouveau buildings and vibrant cultural scene.

name: Etyek
description: A wine region near Budapest known for its excellent white wines and charming vineyards. Wine tours and tastings offer a wonderful way to experience local culture.

name: Tata Castle
description: A beautiful castle located by a lake, surrounded by stunning landscapes. It offers rich historical insights and picturesque views.

name: Pannonhalma Archabbey
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this historic abbey is a center of Benedictine monasticism and offers stunning architecture and beautiful gardens.

name: Szentgotthárd
description: A charming town with a rich history, featuring the impressive Szentgotthárd Abbey and beautiful natural surroundings, perfect for exploring.

name: Ráckeve
description: A picturesque town along the Danube River, known for its historic buildings and scenic views. It's a great spot for cycling and boating.

name: Hévíz Lake
description: The largest thermal lake in the world, known for its healing properties. Visitors can enjoy swimming in its warm waters, surrounded by a stunning natural setting.

name: Balatonfüred
description: A popular resort town on Lake Balaton, known for its beautiful promenade, wellness spas, and vibrant nightlife. It's a hub for summer activities.

name: Keszthely
description: A charming town on the shores of Lake Balaton, known for its beautiful architecture and the Helikon Palace Museum. It's a great place to explore local culture.

name: Budapest Opera House
description: A stunning neo-Renaissance opera house renowned for its acoustics and beautiful architecture. It hosts world-class performances and guided tours.

name: Sziget Festival
description: One of Europe's largest music and cultural festivals, held annually on Óbuda Island. It attracts international artists and thousands of visitors for a week of music and fun.
